list_definition.definition: a building in which a car etc is kept

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a house with a double garage.

list_definition.definition: a building where cars are repaired and usually petrol/gas, oil etc is sold

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has taken his car to the garage to be repaired.

list_ex_of_english: We have allowed the proliferation of outlets—the sale of liquor in restaurants, clubs, corner shops, supermarkets and even garages.
Roads were built, as well as shops, garages, and theatres.
Of course, in the right context, it could refer to a 'person' made out of garages, or one who eats garages or one who collects garages.
Thus, out-of school musical practices no longer take place only in garages, cellars, or occasional performances at school parties.
In both cases, the parking garages were integrated in the block.
Individual garages and car ports were considered together with forecourt, car court and street parking.
At the camp there were recreational rooms, hospitals, garages, roadways, and so on, to be constructed.
Repairs are being done at many of the garages.
